intro: Sedum schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Ethiopia. It features fleshy, upright stems and opposite, oblong leaves that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil. Sedum schimperi is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
